review.title: Lovely central hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, clean, comfortable, centrally located, in lovely grounds
review.positiveRemarks: reception staff were particularly helpful even parking my car for me. breakfast was wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: centrally located near cathedral  with sights and shopping very close

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Central location,easy walk from train or airport bus drop off point. Hotel staff and location good to all the sights.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel very quiet, clean accommodation. Breakfast plentiful and good value, set you up for the day.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff need a lesson in making a good cup of tea! Coffee naturally better!
review.locationRemarks: Good location, direct walk to cathredral.

review.title: Great location, beautiful building
review.reviewText: This is such a lovely hotel, with a terrific restaurant and a wonderful staff. My room was very comfortable and clean

This hotel is so nice. It is located near the cathedral and good restaurants and shops and live music. We arrived early and they allowed us to check in and get some sleep so we could enjoy the evening! Such nice service, even upgrading us without charge.
review.positiveRemarks: beautiful hotel in great location with free parking and friendly staff

review.title: Perfection Plus
review.reviewText: Four of us (two couples) stayed here for three nights on our trip through Northern Spain and we were totally delighted by this hotel, an old convent which has been converted and totally modernized.  Amenities & decor were faultless.  Our rooms were reasonably spacious and very comfortable.  The variety & quality of food offered at both breakfasts and dinners could only be described as "haute cuisine".  The staff were very attentive & helpful.   The hotel is located right in the old city and has it's own secure parking lot.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, including the food, the high level of service, the security and the refreshing swimming pool.
review.locationRemarks:
Leave your car at the hotel and walk about the old city.
The cathedral is amazing.  The tapas bars are fascinating, best where tapas are on display.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location in an historic building
review.reviewText: Perfectly located with comfortable, but not opulent rooms and a nice staff.
review.locationRemarks: Located right in the historic old town of Santiago.

review.title: Great hotel very close to the cathedral.
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of the cathedral and old town. The hotel monastery menu is quite good and the staff fawns on you. The only negative is that the rooms used to be monk cells and therefore small for a facility of this quality. Everything else is first class I will return.
review.locationRemarks: Within 600 meters of the cathedral and a couple hundred more meters to the old town. Too many museums and churches to list.

review.title: A peaceful haven
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff when my  luggage from the USA didn't arrive.

review.title: A Monumental Success
review.reviewText: The hotel oozes charm and charisma as you enter the doors. Dark wood and flagstone floors and the air of history wafts through the foyer, then, the modern world encroaches by way of a glass lift. The cool interior of the rooms offer a sublime and other worldly experience of seclusion within the four feet deep walls. The Monument hotel is part of the Medieval city as opposed to being a tourist attraction. So to truly immerse yourself in the spirit of Santiago, the San Francisco hotel offers the gateway to that realization. The staff will help you navigate the streets and draw you accurate and concise maps to guide you through. The breakfast buffet offers a first class assortment of delicacies to suit all tastes. The swimming pool and jacuzzi are well maintained and seldom busy, so all in all, I cannot think of a finer way to begin your voyage around Galicia. My thanks to all the staff who were so kind and helpful, and in the immortal words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, I'll be back.............Stoppa O'Reilly

review.title: Grandeur  Mixed With Modern To Good Effect
review.reviewText: Although not quite as grand as the nearby Parador, this is still quite palatial.   Outside it is an old monastery.   Inside there is a good mix of ancient and modern, rough stone passages but also ramps and glass lifts, and the glass floors to show the archeological excavations are a nice touch.   The rooms are comfortable although the window shutters are either quaint or annoying, depending on your level of patience.    In such places as these, the reception staff can sometimes be a little impersonal.  No such problems here.   We were warmly welcomed and given clear directions to the best nearby restaurants.  In Santiago del Compostela,  a very helpful thing indeed..
review.negativeRemarks: The shower was difficult to use without flooding the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the sights of Santiago, particularly the Catedral

review.title: Good location, close to the center of the old town
review.reviewText: Very courteous and helpful personnel, very nicely done restauration of an old monastery made modern and confortable. Very good restaurant in the hotel, also a lot of good taberns at a short walking distance.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel for the end of the Camino
review.reviewText: An historic and comfortable hotel near the Cathedral in Santiago.  A fine stay, good restaurant and helpful staff.

review.title: Wonderful hotel full of history
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel full of history. Great location. Large rooms

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a fabulous place to stay, if you do not want to spend a lot more money to stay at the Parador.
Hotel is meticulously clean! Our floor was even washed everyday! For a former convent, the atmosphere is open and bright. Planners did a fantastic job of maintaining the old stone of the convent with a new vibrancy. Very pleasant place to stay! Has indoor pool for serious swimmers, and a hot tub.
Breakfast was delicious with a large selection of eggs, pastries, fruit, bread, and some incredible desserts!
Staff was very friendly and helpful. House-keeping personnel are very friendly and conscientious.
Definitely go to see the two attached cloisters AND eat in the restaurant off of the cloisters! We had their "menu al dia" which was exquisite. We were SO glad we decided to try their restaurant, because it is one of the best in Santiago! I have been to Santiago many times, and this is one of the best, in food and ambience.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent! It is right behind the Parador, and one block from the Cathedral.

review.title: beautiful hotel well situated near the Cathedral
review.reviewText: Luxury hotel with all faclities. Very private and quiet and only need to pick up the phone for any assistance required. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Excellent position for visiting the Cathedral.
review.locationRemarks: Cathedral very close by, easy walking distance to cafe and shops

review.title: Tired pilgrims
review.reviewText:
Staff were very friendly.

Comfortable beds and pillows with very large rooms.

Great open courtyard with fountain to sit in and relax.

Location very close to Cathedral and main square.
review.locationRemarks: Superb. a short stroll to the Cathedral and Shopping precinct

review.title: Missing from Spanish Hotels.
review.reviewText: Like other Spanish hotels, this hotel supplies bathroom toiletries such as comb, toothbrush and packaged rissues, which most people already have. It needs to provide shampoo, conditioner and a small tube of toothpaste.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Close to the Cathedral but away from the noise.

review.title: Comfort and history
review.reviewText: Soundproofing in some rooms is not what it could be. After raising the issue we were moved to a quieter room. This hotel seems to have a habit of closing the restaurant and moving customers to an uninspiring cafeteria when it has large conference or wedding events. Not a problem because of the huge number of other eateries but we didn't eat in the hotel and breakfast is better value elsewhere in Santiago.

review.title: Excellent hotel choice
review.reviewText: Great hotel and very central. Staff so friendly and helpful. Room was quite large and furnished to a very high standard. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size and well fitted out. The whole hotel has been tastefully decorated. Also, being a converted convent, it has a wonderful ambience with the character of the city. Ample car parking space if maybe a little tricky to find the car park. Free use of PCs in the foyer. Definitely recommended.
review.locationRemarks: Very central - less then 5 minute walk from the cathedral

review.title: very interesting place!
review.reviewText:
i choose it because location and the pool. First one very good, second one ....close when I want to use it because the lights work automatic!
not good .
review.locationRemarks: waking distance to the historic centre and Cathedral and other churches.

review.title: Outstanding option in Santiago de Campostela
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location, very near the Cathedral, quite charming and historical in itself, and an excellent alternative to the nearby parador. Rooms were quite nice, price was an excellent value, staff were helpful. Chapel attached is beautiful and the museum of the Holy Land incorporated in that chapel is very informative and well done.

Outstanding breakfast and plenty of attractive common areas for socializing with friends.

review.title: "Great hotel for families"
review.reviewText:
San Francisco Hotel Monumento has stone walls of the monastery, but excellent
5 star conveniences inside the room. The Cathedral and Plaza Obradoiro are
short walk away. The hotel staff were very helpful to us. Our missing luggage was
delivered by the airline next day and the staff placed it promptly in the room.

The cafe in house and the free internet service (two computers) are additional
value.

Overall an excellent hotel to stay and value for your money.
review.positiveRemarks: Smiling staff, closeness to the cathedral

review.title: Well located hotel with a pool
review.reviewText:
Great location, only a few minutes walk from the cathedral. The hotel itself was clean and spacious, including free internet in the office area. The staff were very helpful and always friendly.
We were able to put a travel cot in a seperated section (via a heavey curtain) of the room, thus allowing us to stay up after the little one had gone to bed.
The main reason for choosing this hotel was for the indoor pool. After reading a few reviews I was uncertain as to what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean and well sized pool with good changing facilities. We had no problems in getting towels or using the lockers. The pool provided a refreshing alternative on a very hot day and a useful filler as much of the town seems closed during the early afternoon. The water was a good temperature and the little one loved it!
review.locationRemarks: Great location, only a few minutes from tourist central.

review.title: Delightful accommodation.
review.reviewText: We were delighted overall with our hotel and made our stay in Santiago de Compostela most comfortable.We were most impressed with the location, quality of furnishings and decor, peacefulness and enjoyed the pool area.
review.negativeRemarks: A small point, there was no wifi signal in bedroom for iPad
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, close to the cathedral yet set in own grounds.

review.title: WiFi and Pool
review.reviewText:
WiFi does not work at rooms...staff thinks that's normal.... Even at lobby internet service is slow and breaks.
Pool opens @ 10am and check out its at 11am. The pool guy can not work late or earlier.... Was the answer.
The breakfast buffet is good. Hotel location excellent. Rooms clean and quiet. Staff polite
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent, rooms are quiet and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: No Wifi, pool opens at 10am because the boss says so.

review.title: Good hotel in agreat location. Free parking!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is its key feature. However, it is a very good hotel as well. The rooms are spacious, albeit a little spartan for some people's tastes, clean and quiet. The staff are very helpful. For a city centre hotel in an old city like Santiago, one big advantage is accessible (and free) parking. Breakfast is far too expensive, but there are numerous caf√©s nearby.
review.locationRemarks: One short block from the cathedral. Very close to the centre of the city, but surprisingly quiet.

review.title: Best hotel in Santiago Compostela
review.reviewText: if we had to go to Santiago again, we would never consider any other hotel.

review.title: Convenient hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated near the Cathedral. We went back to the hotel for a short break during the day or after lunch. Although it is a 4 star hotel, it is not decorated as much as the older hotels - may be because it is a old convent and it has a stoney appearance inside. Staff attitude are not of friendly type but more of a business hotel - short answers to everything.

review.title: A great weekend break!
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel in a great position. Only negative being the bar. it was open but empty so no atmosphere. Staff were helpful and friendly. We will be going back to Santiago (hopefully when it's not raining) and we will stay in the San Francisco.
